required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Learn About the Effect of Elevit (a Food Supplement Containing Several Vitamins, Minerals, Lutein and DHA) on the Nutrient Content in the Breast Milk and Blood of Women During Breastfeeding Period and on Babies' Physical Growth Parameters
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Multiple Micronutrients, Lutein and Docosahexaenoic Acid (DHA) Supplementation During Lactation on Human Milk Nutrient Content, Maternal Blood Biomarkers and Infant Anthropometric Parameters

brief_summary.textblock:
The aim of the study is to learn about the effect of multi-micronutrient, lutein and DHA supplementation (Elevit Breastfeeding & Postnatal Care) on the breast milk nutrient composition and babies physical growth parameters.
Mothers participating in this study received either Elevit or placebo orally once a day for 12 weeks starting from 4 to 6 weeks after delivery. Blood, urine and milk samples were collected from the mothers and physical parameters like size and weight were collected from the babies to assess the effect of the supplementation.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in human milk total lipid docosahexaenoic acid (DHA) content: % DHA concentration relative to total milk
primary_outcome.time_frame: At Baseline and 6 weeks and 12 weeks
primary_outcome.description: The primary endpoint will be analyzed using the analysis of covariance (ANCOVA) with supplementation as fixed effect and baseline value as covariate.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in blood parameters: % concentration relative to total milk
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At Baseline and 6 weeks and 12 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Fatty acids (FA) in plasma and glycerophospholipids (GPL); DHA/total fatty acid (TFA) ratio; IFN-gamma; TGF-beta; Folic acid, Vitamin B12 and homocystein; 25-Hydroxivitamin D; Alpha-tocopherol and retinol; Carotenoids (lutein, zeaxanthin, beta-cryptoxanthin, lycopene, carotene)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in milk parameters: % concentration relative to total milk
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At Baseline and 6 weeks and 12 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Total lipids; DHA/total FA ratio; Milk macronutrient content; IFN-gamma; TGF-beta; Alpha-tocopherol and retinol; Carotenoids (lutein, zeaxanthin, beta-cryptoxanthin, lycopene, carotene)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline: Maternal BMI kg/m2
Change from baseline: Maternal fatigue questionnaire
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At Baseline and 6 weeks and 12 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline: Maternal food frequancy questionnaire
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At Baseline and 6 weeks and 12 weeks
At Baseline and 6 weeks and 12 weeks
At Baseline and 6 weeks and 12 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline: Infant Calculation of Weight Standard Deviation Scores (SDS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At Baseline and 6 weeks and 12 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline: Infant Calculation of Length Standard Deviation Scores (SDS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At Baseline and 6 weeks and 12 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: AE relationship to the investigational product

arm_group.description: At randomization (Visit 2), from four to six weeks after delivery, eligible actating women will be equally randomized to one of the study arms (supplementation arm or placebo arm) and will assume the supplement or placebo once daily for a duration of 12 weeks.

At randomization (Visit 2), from four to six weeks after delivery, eligible actating women will be equally randomized to one of the study arms (supplementation arm or placebo arm) and will assume the supplement or placebo once daily for a duration of 12 weeks.

intervention.description: Multi-micronutrients, lutein and DHA soft gel capsules; one capsule daily, oral
No active ingredients except of 225 μg iodine; One capsule daily, oral
